chapter.title: Commands
chapter.para: This chapter explains how to use features inherited from Twiddle. Also it contains list of supported commands along with comprehensive description of each command and options supported by specific command.

important.para: White spaces ARE NOT supported within argument values.
Specific shell characters must be escaped or value of argument must be quoted.
Some terminal intput include "\" - it indicates that command is continued from new line, if copy/paste is used on example, this sign should be removed.

note.para: Options can have long and short form. Short form -s, accept parameter without equal sign, ie: -slocalhost. Long options require equals sign, ie: --server=localhost
&THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; operations support long and short form. Operation options are specified ONLY in long form.

section.title: Twiddle
section.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; provide two scripts to run command line, Windows batch and *NIX bash script. Both accept the same set of options/parameters:

listitem.para: options - options which affect how Twiddle executes, ie. address of server, user name/password
command - command which should handle CLI invocation
command_arguments - options and arguments specific for command

section.para: Following options can be passed directly to twiddle:

listitem.para: displays available commands along with simple description.
displays detailed help message for command with specified commandName.
creates system property with specific name. If value is passed it is assigned to it.
specifies URL of RMI container. URL has following form: <IP[:PORT]>
specifies RMI adapter to be used. Example value: jmx/rmi/RMIAdaptor
specifies name of user to be used for AA
specifies password for user to be used for AA
instructs Twiddle to execute without output
